page.title: 07A HORNSEA CHILD IN 1940
page.content: Forty years ago Hornsea only had{two {thousand people.}The new{school}was in Newbegin and had a large{playing field where they played{games}and did{roller {skating}on the playground. Children went{home}for their{lunch}and didn't wear uniform. If the children were {naughty}at school, a slipper or a ruler was used and the Headmaster kept {a punishment book. On{Sundays}the children wore their {Sunday clothes}and went to{Sunday {School.}Afterwards they went for{a {walk}to the Mere or the Beach. Sometimes they were given{2d each}and {bought}some{lucky bags}from the shop and found sweets and whistles in them. In the{winter}when the{Mere}was{frozen they often{skated.}There was a{cinema in Hornsea and one of the{favourite films was{Snow White. Emma Simpson
